homePage.name: M.Sadegh Hadipour
homePage.summary: A highly skilled and experienced front-end developer with over 3 years of experience in designing and developing responsive websites and web applications.
homePage.about:
I am a front-end developer with over 3 years of experience in designing and developing responsive websites and web applications. Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and various front-end frameworks such as Vue, Angular, and React. Experienced in agile development methodology, and familiar with version control tools such as Git. Strong communication and collaboration skills, and able to work effectively in a team environment.

Work Experience:

Freelance
Oct 2022 to present (1 year)

Working with new JavaScript framework such as: Angular, React, Vuetify.js, Chart.js, and to make multi language web site i learned how to work with i18n. you can find my projects on my GitHub page. Also, I made the 2cgallery site responsive in both Persian and English versions.

Front Developer
Filioâ„¢ simplifies saving and documenting site photos and videos for construction, inspection and more.
Dec 2021 to Oct 2022 (10 mos)

  • Collaborate with designers and back-end developers to create responsive websites and web applications using Vue, quasar and other front-end technologies.
  • Implement designs and user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, while ensuring cross-browser compatibility and accessibility.
  • Develop and maintain code libraries, style guides, and other documentation to ensure consistency and code reusability.
  • Participate in code reviews and provide feedback on coding best practices and optimization techniques.
  • Troubleshoot issues related to front-end development, and work with the team to resolve bugs and performance issues.

Working on my skills with some experimental projects. in this projects i challenge myself with complexity of form validation, router guard, state management, responsive design and implement backend using Node.js, Express.js and MongoDB. you can find my projects on my GitHub page.
